title: How to Make a Lettuce Salad

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
You will need:
Iceberg lettuce leaves
Celery
Tomatoes
Dressing of choice
Vinegar
Salt and pepper to taste.

steps.headline: Wash the lettuce under tap water.
steps.description: This helps to get rid of any germs on the lettuce.

steps.headline: Pat the lettuce dry if you want.
steps.description: Alternatively, place it into a salad spinner.

steps.headline: Set up a knife and chopping board.
steps.description: Chop the lettuce into smaller pieces.

steps.headline: Add the pieces of lettuce to the salad bowl.
Add other basic ingredients.
steps.description: Good choices include: chopped celery, sliced tomatoes, a little dressing, some vinegar, and salt and pepper. Keep it simple.

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
You will need:
1 head romaine lettuce
1 bunch fresh spinach
1 cup dried cranberries
3 green onions
1/2 cup glazed almonds
3/4 cup Parmesan cheese, grated (fresh is best)
1/2 cup balsamic vinegar
1/2 cup olive oil
1/4 cup sugar
Salt and pepper to taste.

steps.headline: Pull the leaves apart on the lettuce.
steps.description: Wash, rinse and spin dry.

steps.headline: Add the lettuce leaves to a salad bowl.
Wash the spinach.
steps.description: Rinse and spin dry. Also add to the bowl.

steps.headline: Cut the green onions into small pieces.
steps.description: Add to the salad. Gently toss together.

steps.headline: Sprinkle over the the dried cranberries.
Make the dressing.
steps.description: Mix the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, sugar and salt and pepper together. Drizzle over the salad.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the top with the glazed almonds.
steps.description: Finish with a generous sprinkling of Parmesan cheese.

steps.headline: Serve immediately.
steps.description: Alternatively, cover and keep refrigerated until needed. If not using immediately, leave adding the dressing and topping until serving time.

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
You will need:
6 cups romaine lettuce, chopped
1 cup of strawberry slices
1 cup blueberries
1 cup mandarin oranges
1 cup pineapple chunks in juice
1 cup pecans
Grilled chicken breast, in chunks (optional)
1/2 cup mayonnaise
1 tablespoon poppy seeds.

steps.headline: Prepare the lettuce.
steps.description: Wash, dry and cut the lettuce. Place in the salad bowl.

steps.headline: Add the fruit and juice.
steps.description: Add the nuts and chicken meat. Toss through gently.

steps.headline: Pour the mayonnaise over the top.
Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
You will need:
1 medium lettuce, leaves removed and cut into smaller pieces
1 cup fresh parsley, minced
4 hard boiled eggs
2 large tomatoes, chopped
1 package (10 ounces) frozen peas, thawed and patted dry
6 strips of bacon, cooked and crumbled
1 cup shredded mild cheese
1 small to medium red onion, chopped finely
1- 1/12 cups mayonnaise
1/2 cup sour cream
1 teaspoon dill weed
3/4 teaspoon dried basil
Pinch salt, to taste
Pepper, to taste
Fresh dill, optional (for garnish).

steps.headline: Find a suitable large container.
steps.description: A large glass bowl is best, as the diners can see the layers when the salad is placed on the table.

steps.headline: Layer the food into the glass container.
steps.description:
A good layout is to place the lettuce at the base of the bowl, then add the rest in layers as follows:
Parsley
Eggs
Tomatoes
Peas
Bacon
Cheese
Onion.

steps.headline: Add the mayonnaise, sour cream, dill, basil, salt and pepper to a small mixing bowl.
steps.description: Mix well to form the dressing.

steps.headline: Spread the dressing over the top of the salad.
Cover the bowl.
steps.description: Place in the refrigerator to chill. It can be chilled for several hours, or left overnight and served the next day.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: As a final touch, add dill sprigs for a garnish. This is optional.

text:
Basic lettuce salad Gather the ingredients. You will need:
Iceberg lettuce leaves
Celery
Tomatoes
Dressing of choice
Vinegar
Salt and pepper to taste. Wash the lettuce under tap water. This helps to get rid of any germs on the lettuce. Pat the lettuce dry if you want. Alternatively, place it into a salad spinner. Set up a knife and chopping board. Chop the lettuce into smaller pieces. Add the pieces of lettuce to the salad bowl.  Add other basic ingredients. Good choices include: chopped celery, sliced tomatoes, a little dressing, some vinegar, and salt and pepper. Keep it simple. Enjoy your salad!  Cranberry almond lettuce salad Gather the ingredients. You will need:
1 head romaine lettuce
1 bunch fresh spinach
1 cup dried cranberries
3 green onions
1/2 cup glazed almonds
3/4 cup Parmesan cheese, grated (fresh is best)
1/2 cup balsamic vinegar
1/2 cup olive oil
1/4 cup sugar
Salt and pepper to taste. Pull the leaves apart on the lettuce. Wash, rinse and spin dry. Add the lettuce leaves to a salad bowl.  Wash the spinach. Rinse and spin dry. Also add to the bowl. Cut the green onions into small pieces. Add to the salad. Gently toss together. Sprinkle over the the dried cranberries.  Make the dressing. Mix the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, sugar and salt and pepper together. Drizzle over the salad. Sprinkle the top with the glazed almonds. Finish with a generous sprinkling of Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately. Alternatively, cover and keep refrigerated until needed. If not using immediately, leave adding the dressing and topping until serving time. Strawberry poppyseed lettuce salad Gather the ingredients. You will need:
6 cups romaine lettuce, chopped
1 cup of strawberry slices
1 cup blueberries
1 cup mandarin oranges
1 cup pineapple chunks in juice
1 cup pecans
Grilled chicken breast, in chunks (optional)
1/2 cup mayonnaise
1 tablespoon poppy seeds. Prepare the lettuce. Wash, dry and cut the lettuce. Place in the salad bowl. Add the fruit and juice. Add the nuts and chicken meat. Toss through gently. Pour the mayonnaise over the top.  Sprinkle with poppy seeds.  Layered lettuce salad Gather the ingredients. You will need:
1 medium lettuce, leaves removed and cut into smaller pieces
1 cup fresh parsley, minced
4 hard boiled eggs
2 large tomatoes, chopped
1 package (10 ounces) frozen peas, thawed and patted dry
6 strips of bacon, cooked and crumbled
1 cup shredded mild cheese
1 small to medium red onion, chopped finely
1- 1/12 cups mayonnaise
1/2 cup sour cream
1 teaspoon dill weed
3/4 teaspoon dried basil
Pinch salt, to taste
Pepper, to taste
Fresh dill, optional (for garnish). Find a suitable large container. A large glass bowl is best, as the diners can see the layers when the salad is placed on the table. Layer the food into the glass container. A good layout is to place the lettuce at the base of the bowl, then add the rest in layers as follows:
Parsley
Eggs
Tomatoes
Peas
Bacon
Cheese
Onion. Add the mayonnaise, sour cream, dill, basil, salt and pepper to a small mixing bowl. Mix well to form the dressing. Spread the dressing over the top of the salad.  Cover the bowl. Place in the refrigerator to chill. It can be chilled for several hours, or left overnight and served the next day. Serve. As a final touch, add dill sprigs for a garnish. This is optional.
